Summary I am one of the founding members of Intel Capital in Europe. 
 
Intel Capital is the largest venture & growth capital investor in the world, investing from $300M to $700M per annum globally. Specifically in Western Europe & Israel, we invest from $50M to $150M per annum and have achieved top quartile returns and are seen as one of the top investors in this region.  
 
Intel Capital invests in TMT related businesses with high growth potential. Since 1998 we have invested over $1.35B in Western Europe & Israel. 
 
I have extensive VC experience having worked on a substantial number of transactions and boards for Intel Capital over the past years. These transactions ranged from early stage, pre-revenue companies to late stage investments, including public companies and spin outs. Amongst the investments I worked on are Azure Solutions (acquired by Subex), eTel (acquired by Telecom Austria), Imagination technologies (listed in the LSE), Silicon Hive (acquired by Intel), IPTego (acquired by AcmePacket), Aldebaran Robotics (acquired by Softbank), Anobit (acquired by Apple), Indisys (acquired by Intel), Omek (acquired by Intel) and Tribold (acquired by Sigma Systems). Currently I am a Director on the VOSS & Adaptive Mobile Security boards and Board Observer in Sigfox, FeedHenry and News Republic. 
 
I am responsible for Intel Capital’s activity in Western Europe & Israel. I am a voting member of Intel Capital’s investment committee. I am responsible for the investment decisions in my region and have full responsibility over the entire Western European and Israeli portfolio and investment team. 
 
I have investment experience in all major Western European countries, Israel, US, Hungary, Russia, UAE and Brazil.
